Package scheduler.tools

Class DateAndTime

java.lang.Object
scheduler.tools.DateAndTime
public class DateAndTime
extends java.lang.Object
Version:
1.0 A class to handle date and time gets, comparisons, and gets.
Author:
Brayden McArthur

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentDateAndTime

      public java.lang.String getCurrentDateAndTime()
      Gets the current date and time and formats it for the database
      Returns:
      the current local date/time as a string

    • getUtcFromLocal

      public java.lang.String getUtcFromLocal​(java.lang.String date)
      Converts a given date to UTC.
      Parameters:
      date - A string representing a local date of pattern "yyyy-MM-dd kk:mm:ss" that will be converted to UTC.
      Returns:
      Returns the corresponding UTC as a string.

    • getLocalFromUtc

      public java.lang.String getLocalFromUtc​(java.lang.String date)
      Converts a given date to Local time.
      Parameters:
      date - A String representing a UTC date of pattern "yyyy-MM-dd kk:mm:ss that will be converted to Local.
      Returns:
      Returns the corresponding Local date/time as a String.

    • formatDateAndTime

      public java.lang.String formatDateAndTime​(java.lang.String date)
      Used for validating user input in the start/end fields. If it can successfully perform the action, the provided date is valid. Else, it is an invalid date.
      Parameters:
      date - provided by the user to be checked.
      Returns:
      the date formatted to the dateTimerFormatter.

    • checkMeetingWithinMinutes

      public boolean checkMeetingWithinMinutes() throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks if a there is a meeting within 15 minutes of the user's login time so that an alert can be displayed.
      Returns:
      Returns true if an appointment is scheduled within 15 minutes of login or false if there are no appointments scheduled within 15 minutes of login.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is a problem in the Fetcher class.

    • isOverlapping

      public boolean isOverlapping​(int appointmentId, java.lang.String start, java.lang.String end) throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks if the appointment that the user is adding/modifying is overlapping with any existing appointments in the database.
      Parameters:
      appointmentId - A valid Appointment_ID from the database.
      start - A start date associated with an Appointment object provided as a string.
      end - An end date associated with an Appointment object provided as a string.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the provided start and end times are overlapping with another Appointment.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is a problem in the Fetcher class.

    • isBefore

      public boolean isBefore​(java.lang.String start, java.lang.String end)
      Checks if a provided start date/time occurs before a provided end date/time.
      Parameters:
      start - A start date/time provided as a string
      end - An end date/time provided as a string
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value. True if the start time occurs before the end time or false if not.

    • compareEasternTime

      public boolean compareEasternTime​(java.lang.String date)
      Checks if the provided date's time is outside of the EST open/close hours.
      Parameters:
      date - A UTC date/time provided as a string, which will be converted to EST for direct comparison.
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value. True if the provided date falls within the EST schedule or false if not.

    • compareWeek

      public boolean compareWeek​(java.lang.String date)
      Checks if a provided date/time occurs within the next week.
      Parameters:
      date - A date/time provided as a string.
      Returns:
      Returns false if the provided date occurs before or after the next week or true if not.

    • compareMonth

      public boolean compareMonth​(java.lang.String date)
      Checks if a provided date/time occurs within the next month.
      Parameters:
      date - A date/time provided as a string.
      Returns:
      Returns false if the provided date occurs before or after the next month or true if not.

    • hoursScheduled

      public double hoursScheduled​(java.lang.String start, java.lang.String end)
      Calculates the hours between a provided start and end date/time.
      Parameters:
      start - A start date/time provided as a string.
      end - An end date/time provided as a string.
      Returns:
      Returns a double value representing the hours between the provided dates.
